data.title: add convenience methods to TimeUtils
data.body: Cut down on boilerplate

data.title: Add TransformDrawable to GWT
data.body: TransformDrawable was breaking GWT.

data.title: Adds texture filters and mip maps as params to free type font generation
data.body: See issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/840

data.title: Android (fragment): Added isFragment method + Fixed possible ClassNotFoundException
data.body:
This allows us to make check if the app is a fragment without having the
developer depend on the support jar. This prevents an ClassNotFoundException in AndroidGraphics that could occur if support jar is missing. My bad.

data.title: A typo fix in Slider class, and a workaround for zero-width Label
Android (Fragment): Deprecation cleanup
data.body:
- Also fixed a regression that caused my fix to #912 to no longer work
- Minor Formatting

data.title: Added missing methods from Matrix4 GWT emulated class
data.body:
When attempting to build the html module using the libgdx maven archetype, I encountered errors with Matrix4's emulated class missing methods which are in the gdx Matrix4 class. 

This commit added the missing methods. It also updated a few instances of "angles" to "degrees" (mirroring changes to the gdx Matrix4 version).

First pull request to libgdx, please be gentile :)

data.title: spine-runtimes / spine-libgdx for gdx-setup-ui
data.body:
"feature request"
Hi there,
I'm wondering if you're able to add an entry for the https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-runtimes/tree/master/spine-libgdx runtime to this file: http://libgdx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/extensions/gdx-setup-ui/config/config.txt.

This would make the runtime available for chosing as library in the gdx-setup-ui.
It's not really important but the setup tool will be even more powerful then.

data.title: Bug in Bresenham2 class
Adds genMipMaps to BitmapFontParameter so it can pass it through to TextureParameter
data.body: See issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/841

data.title: Android Backend: Deprecation cleanup
data.body:
Since 2.2 is our minimum I cleaned up most of the deprecation of the
classes. I skipped only what wasn't possible right now or what I (and
eclipse) didn't notice. All using the recommend by Google.

data.title: Android: Removed deprecated FILL_PARENT reference
data.body:
Since we now target 2.2+ we get access to MATCH_PARENT the field that replaced FILL_PARENT.
See: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/ViewGroup.LayoutParams.html#MATCH_PARENT

This is just part of my effort to remove dependence on deprecated code.

data.title: HTML5 support in IntelliJ?
data.body:
Hi there,

I'm wondering if you're able to now support html5 projects in IntelliJ? The gradle link for intellij talks about iOS and HTML5 not being supported, while the maven page:

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Maven-integration

talks about creating run configurations for Desktop and Android, but not for HTML5.

Is HTML5 support being worked on? Could we have a possible eta for it?

This is a very important feature for those who don't like Eclipse but would still like to use LibGDX.

data.title: Parsing xml from jdom2 with newlines
BitmapFont parsing error on legal BMFont (Unicode issue?)
data.body:
The BMFont [in this pastebin](http://pastebin.com/CMpueqX2) seems to be causing parse issues within BitmapFontData. It's a legal file that works with a number of other implementations, but I haven't dug into the cause. Removing the non-ASCII character (âŒ˜) makes it work. data.title: Update DragAndDrop.java
data.body: if you dont want to detect only finger location, you can set it with event.StageX

data.title: Minor code fixes and a workaround for Android OS bug
XXXMap.Entries.remove()
data.body:
Removing an entry from the stash changes its order (the last entry will be copied to the current index).
Because the nextIndex is already set the iterator either loses some entries or, if already at the end of the map, returns invalid values.
Setting back the nextIndex to the currentIndex and advancing again should fix this.

This fixes #1299 for all map implementations.

data.title: slf4j integration with desktop libgdx
data.body:
Was just using libgdx for a smallish project and was really hoping to be able to store logs in a little more flexible of a way than perling stdout. Replacing the stdout backend that's currently used with slf4j/logback wouldn't be a huge change and would allow for more flexibility (i.e., logging to a RollingFileAppender, being able to use a logback.xml to configure it) and probably slightly better performance (it logs on a separate thread).

If there's any interest in this I can hack it together tomorrow or Monday.

data.title: Upgrade to the 0.0.4 version of the RoboVM Gradle plugin.
data.body: Upgrade RoboVM and RoboVM Gradle plugin.

data.title: What is the way to update textures at runtime?
PerformanceCounter has valid logic flipped
data.body:
PerformanceCounter.start() sets valid to false.

PerformanceCounter.tick() only works if value == true, and prints app error if false.

PerformanceCounter.stop() sets valid to true.
